Charmaine NgLevel 6. MasterAnswered on 03 Jun 2018As Gabriel has mentioned, if your school has a installment plan then please go with the school. Otherwise, I'd suggest you take out a study loan (I highly recommend RHB - they had better interest rates vs the other banks) Link here but please do your own homework as there are always promotions etc.​Never use your credit card for school fees if possible. First, for installment plans it's up to the bank's discretion to approve or not. Meaning banks could reject and they don't need to provide you a reason why it is rejected - it is just rejected. Then you'll be slapped with the hefty interests. Two, your credit limit will be limited during these period of time until you clear the sum and if you can't, your credit score will be severely affected as well. Double whammy.0 comments1
